The ToggleDetails component can be used to show/hide content in response to user action. By default, ToggleDetails content is hidden. To override, pass in the `defaultExpanded` prop. ```js --- type: example --- I am expanded! {lorem.paragraph()} ``` ToggleDetails can be controlled: ```js --- type: example --- const Example = () => { const [expanded, setExpanded] = useState(true) const handleChange = (event, expanded) => { setExpanded(expanded) } const handleToggle = () => { setExpanded((prevExpanded) => !prevExpanded) } return (


I am controlled and expanded! {lorem.paragraph()}
) } render() ``` Setting ToggleDetails to `filled` will make the toggle use a full-width [Button](Button) component. ```js --- type: example --- {lorem.paragraph()} ``` ### Icon size / summary text formatting Icon size can be adjusted using the `size` prop with small, medium, and large options. The `summary` prop accepts any node, allowing you to format the summary text as you see fit. In these examples, we are formatting it with the [Text](Text) component. ```js --- type: example ---

icon.description: The icon to display next to the summary text when content is hidden

iconExpanded.description: The icon to display when content is expanded

iconPosition.description: Icon position at the start or end of the summary text

fluidWidth.description: should the summary fill the width of its container

size.description: Choose a size for the expand/collapse icon
